title: Unit 1 Checkpoint: Geometric Foundations & Angles
description: Summative checkpoint assessing mastery of undefined terms, geometric notation, angle classification, complementary/supplementary/vertical angle pairs, and parallel-line transversal relationships including algebraic applications.

remediationResources.reteachFocus: Undefined terms (point, line, plane), collinear/coplanar, segment vs ray vs line notation
Acute/right/obtuse/straight classification, benchmark angles, estimation strategies
Corresponding (F-pattern), alternate interior (Z-pattern), alternate exterior, same-side interior (C-pattern, supplementary), algebraic setup

assessmentProblems.question: Points P, Q, and R lie on line k. Point S does not lie on line k. (a) Are P, Q, R collinear? (b) Are P, Q, S collinear? (c) Are P, Q, R, S coplanar?
assessmentProblems.answer: (a) Yes — P, Q, R all lie on line k, so they are collinear. (b) No — S does not lie on line k. (c) Yes — any three points determine a plane, and we can always find a plane containing P, Q, R, and S (since the first three are collinear, adding any fourth point still keeps them coplanar).

assessmentProblems.question: Angles A and B are complementary. Angle A is 14° more than Angle B. Find both angle measures.
Two lines intersect. One angle measures (5x + 10)° and the vertical angle measures (8x - 20)°. Find x and all four angle measures.
assessmentProblems.answer: Vertical angles are congruent: 5x + 10 = 8x - 20 → 30 = 3x → x = 10. Angle = 5(10) + 10 = 60°. Four angles: 60°, 120°, 60°, 120° (linear pairs sum to 180°).

assessmentProblems.question: Two parallel lines are cut by a transversal. Identify the angle pair type and find the missing angle measure: (a) Corresponding angles: one measures 73°, find the other. (b) Same-side interior angles: one measures 118°, find the other.
assessmentProblems.answer: (a) Corresponding angles are congruent → the other is 73°. (b) Same-side interior angles are supplementary → 180 - 118 = 62°.

assessmentProblems.question: Two parallel lines are cut by a transversal. A pair of alternate interior angles measure (4x + 7)° and (6x - 13)°. Find x and both angle measures.
assessmentProblems.answer: Alternate interior angles are congruent: 4x + 7 = 6x - 13 → 20 = 2x → x = 10. Angles: 4(10) + 7 = 47° and 6(10) - 13 = 47° ✓.

assessmentProblems.question: Two parallel lines are cut by a transversal. A pair of same-side interior angles measure (3x + 25)° and (5x + 11)°. Find x and both angle measures.
assessmentProblems.answer: Same-side interior angles are supplementary: (3x + 25) + (5x + 11) = 180 → 8x + 36 = 180 → 8x = 144 → x = 18. Angles: 3(18) + 25 = 79° and 5(18) + 11 = 101°. Check: 79 + 101 = 180 ✓.

assessmentProblems.question: One angle at an intersection of a transversal with a parallel line measures 52°. Find all 8 angles formed at both intersections.
assessmentProblems.answer: At intersection 1: 52°, 128°, 52°, 128° (vertical pairs + linear pairs). At intersection 2 (by corresponding angles): 52°, 128°, 52°, 128°. All eight angles: four of 52° and four of 128°.

assessmentProblems.question: Angles P and Q are supplementary. Angle P is 5 times Angle Q. Find both angle measures.

ANALYSIS: Two parallel lines are cut by a transversal. One angle is (2x + 3y)° and its corresponding angle is 85°. The supplement of that corresponding angle is (4x - y)°. Find x, y, and verify that the supplement is correct.

answerKeys.gcu1-1: P,Q,R collinear (yes). P,Q,S not collinear. All four coplanar (yes).
